WRITING.TITLE: Clomid and immense anxiety
WRITING.TEXT: Hi guys, New to TRT. I took Clomid for a couple of weeks because I didn't like the idea of T playing with my fertility. Now I'm on testogel but I'm curious whether HCG could work without the same effects.

I tried this for a week. On day 7 my anxiety was so high (something that wasn't there before) and my mood so low that I stopped. It's been 2 weeks and it's still bad to an extent, but different depending on the day.
Do you have any anxiety / low mood with this? I think I had the same on Clomid. Cortisol up to 697 nmol/L and estradiol E2 raised.
Interesting. How long have you been on this/what has worked for you? Can you give me your story a bit more detailed with symptoms etc.? It's nice to have someone to talk to about this.
I also thought HCG was similar/same as clomid but it gives me a bit of hope hearing that maybe it isn't.
Had the exact same experience. Where did you go to from there?

I'm using the gel, but have only used it for a couple of weeks. Some days I feel really good, some I have felt worse but I think I can still attribute some of that to clomid.

gt;E2 follows T. The higher your testosterone levels the higher your estrogen should be. They must always be in the proper ratio. Only time you get symptoms is when your ratio is out of whack. That's interesting, you don't believe high e2 can be an issue?

gt;I got my first bloods pre-TRT recently and my prolactin was 34 ng/mL (ref range: 4-15). My free T was then low at 6 pg/mL (ref range: 9-26) which may be due to high prolactin (as prolactin inhibits LH production - my LH levels were also low and low LH causes low T). My doctor suspects it might be a prolactinoma (benign tumor on the pituitary), but can't get an MRI to confirm due to Covid. He prescribed cabergoline, but it can have some scary side effects.So, instead, I've been taking 100mg of P5P a day and plan on adding 400IU of Vitamin E and 800mg of SAMe here soon as well, all of which have been noted to lower prolactin in studies. It's been about a week and I do feel somewhat better, I've gotten morning wood and libido the past few days which I haven't had in many months. I'm going to stick with this for 6 weeks or so and get my levels tested again before considering TRT.Hoping on TRT is a huge lifelong commitment, so if you have high prolactin, I'd try lowering that first. Interesting, I'm getting an MRI next week. I'm going to look into those. So P5P alone seems to be making you feel better? Have you been feeling any anxiety / emotional?

gt;I did great when I started on TRT, but after about 7 weeks I felt myself backsliding and not feeling as good as I was before while on TRT. My doctor bumped my dose up +30mg per week and two days later I woke up early, wide awake as soon as I opened my eyes. I went downstairs and started feeling more and more energy which turned into anxiety and higher blood pressure throughout the day. I called my doctor who reassured me that it was temporary. It got bad enough that afternoon that I felt like having a drink which calmed me down a bit. A day later I woke up feeling like freakin superman! I wish I could feel that awesome every day for the rest of my life! Anyways, that only lasted for three days then I started feeling normal (just good) after that. Weeks later my hematocrit and hemoglobin started getting a little high and I gave blood which made me feel better. THen my dose was lowered a bit and I've felt fine since then. Thanks for your reply, it's reassuring to hear. I'm on the gel and was taking 2 packs right away and felt aweful. But one pack for the past few days and I've been feeling /better/ than with those 2. I do take .5mg anasrozole every 3/4 days or so though. I think I will stick to that until I feel "stable". After that I'll try slowly bumping the dose.

Well, it might work for you. What's bothering you about cyp? I tried clomid for a couple of weeks. Was fine at first, my testosterone levels went up a fair deal. Problem is so did cortisol and estradiol (way up). I guess it might have worked for me if I stuck it out, added an AI or whatever. But really the only reason to take clomid rather than testosterone I believe would be to preserve fertility. However you can also store semen at a sperm bank and/or try a "PCT" when you want to have children.

I did end up taking a break. Then tried the gel, a pack a day, made me extremely emotinoal and irritable as well. So took another break. However now I attempted the third time, I started with 2 packs, gave me a different experience altogether.. just a lot of energy that turned into anxiety and sweat and waking up int he night. Reduced to 1 pack with small doses of AI and I feel fine. Not excellent or noticeably better even, but at least I don't feel like shit. :) So maybe I'll try to bump the dose (very slowly!)

What I'm posting here isn't backed by any research (that I know of). But as far as I know, there's no ester attached to the T in cream/gel. So it's possible your T levels would be lower during the night, which is when your body makes most of its own T, and so maybe there is less HPA shutdown than when you take an ester like enanthate, where you have super levels the first day that then gradually reduces (but is presumably high during the night as well). Also if you take, (taking gel for an example again), it will typically only place you at mid-range T levels with 1 pack. You'll need to go to max dose to get high levels. So again less suppression if you're at the low/beginner dose.

Very short, all of them. This current one is the longest. Clomid probably around 2 weeks, max. The first testosterone gel try maybe... 10 days.. and this one isn't very far along either. Thanks for your replies btw, it's nice when people are positive on here.
